titles.title: A bill to provide that certain lands shall be in trust for the Pechanga Band of Luiseno Mission Indians of the Pechanga Reservation, California.

action.text: Referred to House Committee on Interior and Insular Affairs.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.
Reported to House by House Committee on Interior and Insular Affairs. Report No: 100-247.
Called up by House on Call of Consent Calendar.
Received in the Senate and read twice and referred to the Committee on Energy and Natural Resources.
Referred to Subcommittee on Public Lands, National Parks.
Favorable Executive Comment Received From Interior.
Committee on Energy and Natural Resources received executive comment from Interior Department.
Senate Committee on Energy and Natural Resources discharged by Unanimous Consent.
Referred to the Committee on Indian Affairs.

calendar.text: Committee on Indian Affairs. Ordered to be reported without amendment favorably.

action.text: Committee on Indian Affairs. Reported to Senate by Senator Inouye without amendment. With written report No. 100-415.

calendar.text: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 785.

vote.text: Passed Senate without amendment by Voice Vote.

committee.subcommittee: Public Lands, National Parks and Forests
committee.name: Senate Energy and Natural Resources

bill.summary: 6/4/1987--Introduced. Provides that the United States' interest in specified lands shall be held in trust for the benefit of the Pechanga Band of Luiseno Mission Indians of California as part of the Pechanga Indian Reservation.
